message_1: Suppose you want to create a cryptographic hash function that takes in an input message of length 1000 bits and outputs a hash of length 256 bits. How many possible hash outputs are there?
message_2: A cryptographic hash function that outputs a hash of length 256 bits can have 2^256 possible hash outputs. This is because each bit can have 2 possible values (0 or 1), and there are 256 bits in the output.
